result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cirilo O Ancira

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed:  Defendant's Treatment Letter.

Defendant Cirilo O Ancira in court.  Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court for Cirilo O Ancira.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Treatment Update Letter.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Treatment Letter

Defendant Cirilo O Ancira in court, appear in person with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40. Court reminded him to comply with the conditions of his bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Attorney Ramon Valdez

Defendant Cirilo O Ancira in court, appear in person with attorney Ramon Valdez appear in person .  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for status. Attorney Valdez needs more time to meet with client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cirilo O Ancira in court with Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for Preliminary Hearing.  States witness is present.  Attorney Valdez appeared as a friend of the court and will possibly be retained.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Status. Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Cirilo O Ancira in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Cirilo O Ancira in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cirilo O Ancira appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
 This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
